Dotted line: fit over the high-temperature region to the 1D Heisenberg chain model (|J/k| = 215 K, g = 2), dashed line: fit over the whole investigated temperature range to the sum of 1D Heisenberg infinite chains and the paramagnetic Curie susceptibilities, solid line: fit to the sum of the paramagnetic susceptibility and the susceptibility of Heisenberg infinite and short chains.

Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl acetate, inset magnifies the high-temperature region. Dotted line: fit over the high-temperature region to the 1D Heisenberg chain model (|J/k| = 215 K, g = 2), dashed line: fit over the whole investigated temperature range to the sum of 1D Heisenberg infinite chains and the paramagnetic Curie susceptibilities, solid line: fit to the sum of the paramagnetic susceptibility and the susceptibility of Heisenberg infinite and short chains.

elements.content: Fig. 1 (a) The 1-dimensional chain of the VO6 octahedra in the VO(CH3COO)2 structure and (b) the 1-dimensional chain of the VO5 square pyramids in the VO(OCH2CH2O) structure.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 1  (a) The 1-dimensional chain of the VO6 octahedra in the VO(CH3COO)2 structure and (b) the 1-dimensional chain of the VO5 square pyramids in the VO(OCH2CH2O) structure.

elements.content: Fig. 2 The chains of (a) corner and (b) edge sharing VO6 octahedra with adjuncted monodentate and bridged VO4 tetrahedra in structures Sr2V3O9 and Ba2V3O9.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 2  The chains of (a) corner and (b) edge sharing VO6 octahedra with adjuncted monodentate and bridged VO4 tetrahedra in structures Sr2V3O9 and Ba2V3O9.

elements.content: Fig. 3 Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl acetate, inset magnifies the high-temperature region. Dotted line: fit over the high-temperature region to the 1D Heisenberg chain model (|J/k| = 215 K, g = 2), dashed line: fit over the whole investigated temperature range to the sum of 1D Heisenberg infinite chains and the paramagnetic Curie susceptibilities, solid line: fit to the sum of the paramagnetic susceptibility and the susceptibility of Heisenberg infinite and short chains.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 3  Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl acetate, inset magnifies the high-temperature region. Dotted line: fit over the high-temperature region to the 1D Heisenberg chain model (|J/k| = 215 K, g = 2), dashed line: fit over the whole investigated temperature range to the sum of 1D Heisenberg infinite chains and the paramagnetic Curie susceptibilities, solid line: fit to the sum of the paramagnetic susceptibility and the susceptibility of Heisenberg infinite and short chains.

elements.content: 11,17111713ligandligands10212223glycol24FTIR18EPR25Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl glycolate. Inset (a) shows reciprocal magnetic susceptibility corrected for the temperature independent contribution (χ0 ≈ 10−5 emu mol−1) and its fit to the Curie–Weiss law. Inset (b) shows magnetic susceptibility after subtraction of the χ0 and the Curie–Weiss contributions, solid line is the best fit to the susceptibility of isolated dimers.

Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl glycolate. Inset (a) shows reciprocal magnetic susceptibility corrected for the temperature independent contribution (χ0 ~ 10-5 emu mol-1) and its fit to the Curie-Weiss law. Inset (b) shows magnetic susceptibility after subtraction of the χ0 and the Curie-Weiss contributions, solid line is the best fit to the susceptibility of isolated dimers.

elements.content: Fig. 4 Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl glycolate. Inset (a) shows reciprocal magnetic susceptibility corrected for the temperature independent contribution (χ0 ≈ 10−5 emu mol−1) and its fit to the Curie–Weiss law. Inset (b) shows magnetic susceptibility after subtraction of the χ0 and the Curie–Weiss contributions, solid line is the best fit to the susceptibility of isolated dimers.
elements.clean_text: Fig. 4  Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl glycolate. Inset (a) shows reciprocal magnetic susceptibility corrected for the temperature independent contribution (χ0 ~ 10-5 emu mol-1) and its fit to the Curie-Weiss law. Inset (b) shows magnetic susceptibility after subtraction of the χ0 and the Curie-Weiss contributions, solid line is the best fit to the susceptibility of isolated dimers.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 3 Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl acetate, inset magnifies the high-temperature region. Dotted line: fit over the high-temperature region to the 1D Heisenberg chain model (|J/k| = 215 K, g = 2), dashed line: fit over the whole investigated temperature range to the sum of 1D Heisenberg infinite chains and the paramagnetic Curie susceptibilities, solid line: fit to the sum of the paramagnetic susceptibility and the susceptibility of Heisenberg infinite and short chains.

Dotted line: fit over the high-temperature region to the 1D Heisenberg chain model (|J/k| = 215 K, g = 2), dashed line: fit over the whole investigated temperature range to the sum of 1D Heisenberg infinite chains and the paramagnetic Curie susceptibilities, solid line: fit to the sum of the paramagnetic susceptibility and the susceptibility of Heisenberg infinite and short chains.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 4 Temperature dependence of magnetic susceptibility of vanadyl glycolate. Inset (a) shows reciprocal magnetic susceptibility corrected for the temperature independent contribution (χ0 ≈ 10−5 emu mol−1) and its fit to the Curie–Weiss law. Inset (b) shows magnetic susceptibility after subtraction of the χ0 and the Curie–Weiss contributions, solid line is the best fit to the susceptibility of isolated dimers.
